Job Title: Driver - Save Mart Roseville DC - 9999 Niblick Dr., Roseville, CA 95678

Location: Roseville, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
About Us

The Save Mart Companies is one of the largest food retailers in California and Nevada. It is home to several well-known brands in food retailing. You might have seen our stores that include Save Mart, Lucky, Lucky California, and Food Maxx. We also have 3 distribution centers and our SMART Transportation trucking firm to transport dry groceries, frozen foods, ice, and novelties to all The Save Mart Companies stores. We are a California grown business, headquartered in the heart of one of the greatest agricultural areas of our nation – Stanislaus County.

The Modesto community is vibrant with great traditions, educational opportunities, and multi-cultural lifestyles. Aside from mild weather year-round, Modesto allows for easy access to many major tourist attractions in California. To the west lies the San Francisco Bay Area (90-miles) and the Santa Cruz Beach (115-miles). To the east is the famed Gold Country “Mother Lode” (50-miles) and a little farther you can find the majestic Sierra Nevada Mountain range, Lake Tahoe (180-miles) and Yosemite National Park (110-miles).

Some of our competitive benefits include exceptionally generous benefits package (Health, Dental, Vision, Life, 401K), Lifelong Learning Educational opportunities, Employee Association (discounted and free tuition options, contests, and support services).

We Are Currently Recruiting For The Position Of

Driver - Save Mart Roseville DC - 9999 Niblick Dr., Roseville, CA 95678

The Driver drives a tractor-trailer combination, applying knowledge of commercial driving regulations, to transport and deliver products to and from warehouses, stores, and other designated locations. Drivers also work to provide excellent customer service and safely assist with unloading and reloading the trailers. This position is responsible for a timely delivery of product, comprehension of various transportation documents, and operating necessary mechanical controls on all tractor-trailers while demonstrating safe driving practices. The Driver interacts with customers in a professional manner and maintains effective communication regarding customer problems and requests.

Key Responsibilities And Accountabilities

Transports product to and from retail stores and distribution centersResponsible for the safe operation of equipment (tractor and trailers) in accordance with all local, state, federal, DOT laws and company standardsInspects vehicles for mechanical items and safety issues Reports to assigned dispatcher and Transportation Supervisor on daily basis for route instructionsDocuments and logs work/rest periods and miles spent driving and retain fuel/toll receiptsManeuvers truck into loading or unloading position, following signals from loading crew as neededCollects and verifies delivery instructions Enters, transcribes, records, stores, or maintains information in written or electronic/magnetic formReport defects, accidents or violationsCounts freight from third-party vendors for backhauls  May load and unload trailers; Wraps goods using pads, packing paper, and containers, and secures load to trailer wall using straps Fastens chain or binders to secure load on trailer during transit Inventories and inspects goods to be moved Obtains customer's signature for services Drives truck to weigh station along route to document weight and conform to state regulations Performs other duties as assigned

Hiring pay range: $23.83 - 28.08

Requirements (Knowledge, Skills And Abilities)

 Proven 1 year working experience as a truck driver Ability to use the onboard computer system to assist in tracking the load from start to destination Ability to drive long hours and travel regularly Extensive knowledge of applicable truck driving rules and regulations Adaptability and foresight to handle unexpected situations (traffic, weather conditions etc.) Ability to Inspect equipment, or materials to identify the cause of errors or other problems or defects Good written and oral communication skills

Education: High School Diploma (or G.E.D.)

Experience: Must have a minimum of 1 year of Class A tractor trailer driving experience on public streets/highways.

Physical: This position requires frequent physical movement, to include standing, sitting, bending, stooping, walking, climbing, kneeling, reaching, handling and rotation. Heavy lifting, carrying, pushing and pulling may be required of objects and/or equipment

Other

 Must possess and maintain a permanent Class A commercial driver’s license Must be flexible to work any 5 days of the week including holidays and weekends Must satisfy driving record requirements

Reference: req36247

Follow Us

Instagram: @savemart

Facebook: Save Mart

YouTube: @savemartsupermarkets

LinkedIn: The Save Mart Companies

The Save Mart Companies is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we welcome resumes from individuals who will contribute to our diverse workforce.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
